p: The HSD led to an increase in urine volume (LSD: 19.1[15.0, 23.3] vs HSD: 37.0[33.7, 46.9] ml/kg BW/day, P < 0.05). Urinary calcium excretion was not significantly different between diets (LSD: 78.6[72.5104.9] vs HSD: 88.8[79.3,96.4] μmol/kg BW/day, P = 0.84), but urinary calcium concentration was lower in HSD (LSD: 4.8[3.2,6.0] vs HSD: 2.5[2.0,2.9] mmol/L, P < 0.05). Urinary oxalate concentration was lower in HSD (LSD: 1.4[1.1, 1.8] vs HSD 0.9[0.7, 1.2] mmol/L, P < 0.01). CaOx RSS was significantly lower with the HSD (LSD: 24.1[13.1, 32.7] vs HSD: 12.7[10.4, 12.4], P < 0.01).
